name: RDT Protocol
summary: A reliable data transfer (RDT) protocol for my second coding assignments for one of my university computer science courses (CS436/636). This project implemented a RDT protocol for both sender and receiver, and also a unreliable newtork emulator.

name: Fashion-MNIST
summary: A image classification for my second Kaggle comeptition for one of my university statistics courses (STAT441/841/CM763). This project implemented a convolutional neural network model and the accuracy was 93.66%.

name: Shallow Water Animation
summary: A 3D shallow water animation which developed as my last coding assignment for one of my university applied maths courses (AMATH 442/642). To generate numerical sumulations at different time for shallow water equation, Finite Volume Method with Lax-Friedrichs Flux and divergence theorem had been used..

name: Personal Website
summary: A place that I use for practicing my HTML 5, CSS 3, and JavaScript skills. It is also a place for you to know me more. Also, I use it to share some information with my friends about Pokemon TCG too. Yes, you are visiting it now!

name: Quadris
summary: A Tetris-like game which developed as the final team project for one of my university computer science courses (CS 246). We had added "Hint" feature to display the Cartesian coordinate for next relative best move. Also, we only used smart pointers in this project. Due to academic integrity and copyright, the source code is not available online.

name: TRACKR
summary: It is an unfinished website which was created as a group project in Hack The North 2017. My job was developed the front-end part. (The unfinished part is we do not know how to link our front-end and back-end together.) We used Microsoft Azure's facial detection API and tracking.js This website will compare one photo (took from camera) with other photos ifrom the database, then return the highest similar photo from database to the user.

name: Mine Sweeper
summary: It is a text-based game which developed for one of my university computer science courses (CS 136). My job was implemented the back-end algorithms (the school provided text graphical user interface). Due to academic integrity and copyright, the source code is not available online.

name: FMM Escape
summary: It is an escape game as my final group project in Canadian high school. We had developed two versions, one is SWING (Java) version and the other one is hsa.Console version.

name: Get It At One
summary: It is a re-made guessing number game program which is developed during my Hong Kong secondary school period. The goal of this program is to learn how to use crt unit to implement a better interface in Pascal console window. Also, users can use the arrow keys to select the choice in menu instead of typing what they want to do.

name: Health Care System
summary: It is a health information system which is developed for my School-based Assessment (SBA, just think it as final year project) in Hong Kong secondary school. Also, this is my first system design project.
